alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 10:03PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Randolph County through 1045 PM EDT... At 1003 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Redkey, or 9 miles south of Portland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Randolph County, including the following locations... Saratoga, Union City and Ridgeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
